title: Limestone Link Walking Route

images.title: Phil Williams / Limestone Link footpath
images.caption: Limestone Link footpath. A view looking to the northeast towards a swinging gate on the footpath as it crosses the lane form Combe Hay to Wellow, just north of Combe Hay Bridge.

images.title: Guy Wareham / Limestone Link
images.caption: The path heading towards the eastern edge of Dolebury Warren. Black Down is on the skyline.

images.caption: Holcombe Swing Bridge, across the Kennet and Avon Canal, near Bathampton, swung open to allow boats to pass through.

images.title: Pierre Terre / Kennet & Avon Canal, Harding's Bridge
images.caption: Kennet and Avon Canal. Approaching Hardings Bridge, near Henngrove wood

images.title: Guy Wareham / Limestone Link
images.caption: The path heading towards the eastern edge of Dolebury Warren. Black Down is on the skyline.

images.title: Phil Williams / Limestone Link footpath
images.caption: A view looking to the northeast towards a swinging gate on the Limestone Link footpath as it crosses the lane form Combe Hay to Wellow, just north of Combe Hay Bridge.

description: Starting at Cold Ashton in St Catherine's Valley, Gloucestershire follow the Limestone Link from the Cotswolds to the Mendip Hills in Somerset. The walk first heads south towards Batheaston where you join the River Avon and the Kennet and Avon Canal for a lovely waterside stretch to Monkton Coombe. You will also pass near to Little Solsbury Hill, made famous by the Peter Gabriel song 'Solsbury Hill'. The second section of the path then takes you through the Mendip Hills with fabulous views of the Chew Valley, Burrington Combe limestone gorge, Dolebury Warren Iron Age Hill Fort, the waterfall at Hallatrow and the final stretch through Burrington common the main highlights.
